text: Alec Brader (born 6 October 1942) is an English professional footballer, schoolteacher and youth athletics coach who played as an inside forward. Following his football career he became a schoolteacher teaching Physical Education, Geography and European Studies, spending most of his career at William Lovell Academy where he eventually became Deputy Headmaster. He also volunteered as a youth athletics coach for Lincolnshire teams for over 40 years. For his services to youth sports he was made a Member of the Order of the British Empire in 2008 New Years Honours list. == References == Category:1942 births Category:People from Horncastle, Lincolnshire Category:English footballers Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Grimsby Town F.C. players Category:Skegness Town A.F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Living people
title: Alec Brader
